title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.35 | 30-11-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: yoga system is helpful to actually control the senses but it is not effective in giving satisfaction to the soul
segments.summary: Narada Muni explains that while yoga can control the senses, it doesn't provide soul satisfaction, which comes from devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Ashtanga Yoga is denying the sense satisfaction, denying mind satisfaction, denying intellectual satisfaction all this by forcibly restraining the senses
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts Ashtanga Yoga's artificial method of denying sense gratification with devotional service's positive engagement of the senses in spiritual activities.

segments.key_quote: a devotee who is engaged in devotional service cannot be allured by Maya because this is a superior engagement
segments.summary: The speaker uses the examples of Vishwamitra Muni and Haridas Thakur to illustrate the difference between artificial sense control and the power of devotional service to overcome Maya.

segments.key_quote: without devotional service of the Lord neither the yoga system nor philosophical speculation can ever become successful
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that pure devotional service is the topmost path to self-realization, superior to yoga, jnana, and karma, and that these other paths are dependent on bhakti.

segments.key_quote: the topmost yogi is the devotee
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by quoting the Bhagavad Gita, stating that the topmost yogi is the devotee.
